title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.36 | 05-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चप्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवेनमहा नमाओम विष्णु पाधाया कृष्ण प्रिष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गवरभानी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पास्चात्य देशतारिने जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधर श्रीवासादी गवरभक्त वृन्दा हरे कृष्ण हरे कृष्ण कृष्ण कृ
नमस्कृत्या नरम्चेवनरोत्तमं देवीम् सरस्वतीम् व्यासम् ततो जयम् उदीरयेत्
In this session we will be discussing from the 36th verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Shreemad Bhagavatam.
Continuing the prayers by Queen Kunti.
The meaning of this verse is
O Krishna, those who continuously hear, chant and repeat your transcendental activities
or take pleasure in others doing so
which alone can stop the repetition of birth and death.
how one can end this repetition of birth and death.
Of course most people do not know
that the real fundamental problem of material existence
is this repetition of birth and death.
So this accepting this material body
while we are actually not got anything to do with matter
and we have our spiritual body
but foolishly we give up that spiritual home
we desire to lord over material nature
and therefore we are forced to take
and we cannot remain in this material body
we have to quit this material body
if we still have desire for lording over
or we have desire for material enjoyment
then we have to continue to accept another body
So jatasyahi dhruva mṛtyu dhruvam janma mṛtasyaca
Krishna explains this in the Bhagavad Gita
for one who has taken his birth in this material world
if one is not liberated at the time of death
then one has to take birth again
So Kunti Devi is now telling
this repetition of birth and death
those who continuously hear, chant and repeat
or even if they don't do it
in somebody else who is doing that
by which they are very easily able to conquer
they are able to stop the repetition of birth and death
So Sri La Pravapa explains in the purple
cannot be seen by our present conditional vision
for seeing the Supreme Lord Sri Krishna
one has to change his present vision
by developing a different condition of life
when Sri Krishna was present personally
as the Supreme Personality of Godhead
here is the Supreme Personality of Godhead
they think he is another ordinary person
but they were unable to appreciate
or when he is personally present
even though the Lord may be
it is not possible to see him
unless we have the necessary vision
God were to appear in front of you
if God comes in front of me
service does not see the Lord face to face. The reason is that the first item shravana is very
important. If hearing is from the right sources, it acts very quickly. Generally people hear from
unauthorized persons. Such unauthorized persons may be very learned by academic qualifications
but because they do not follow the principles of devotional service, hearing from them becomes a
sheer waste of time. Hearing from unauthorized persons will not result in any spiritual advancement.
Sometimes the texts are interpreted fashionably to suit their own purpose. Therefore, first one
should select the text that suits their own purpose. Therefore, first one should select the text that
suits their own purpose. Therefore, first one should select a competent and bonafide speaker and
then hear from him. When the hearing process is perfect and complete, the other processes become
automatically perfect in their own way. After hearing comes chanting and then remembering etc.
There are different transcendental activities of the Lord and each and every one of them is competent
bestow the desired result provided the hearing process is perfect in the
bhagavatam the activities of the Lord begin from his dealings with the
Pandavas that's the first canto of the Srimad Bhagavatam there are many other
pastimes of the Lord in connection with his dealings with the asuras and others
and in the tenth canto the sublime dealings with his conjugal associates
the Gopis as well as his married wives at Dwaraka are mentioned since the Lord
is absolute there is no difference in the transcendental nature of each and
every dealing of the Lord whether the description in the first canto is about
the Lord's dealings with the Pandavas or not the Lord's dealings with the
Pandavas or in some other canto about the Lord's dealings with some other
asuras or it is the dealing of the Lord with his most beloved devotees the Gopis
or his beloved Queens at Dwaraka all are transcendental all are transcendental
but sometimes people in an unauthorized hearing
process take more interest in hearing about his dealings with the Gopis such
an inclination indicates the lusty feelings of the hearer so a bona fide
speaker of the dealings of the Lord never indulges in such hearings one must
hear about the Lord from the very beginning as in the Srimad Bhagavatam or
and that will help the hearer attain perfection by progressive development one should not
therefore consider that his dealings that means Krishna's dealings with the Pandavas
are less important than his dealings with the Gopis we must always remember that the
Lord is always transcendental to any mundane attachment Krishna doesn't have any attachment
any material attachment at all in all the above mentioned dealings of the Lord he is
the hero in all circumstances and hearing about him or about his devotees or combatants
is conducive to spiritual life it is said that the Vedas and Puranas etc are all made
to revive our lost relation with him.
essential it's absolutely essential in the previous verses Kunti Devi has explained
that those who have come to this material world are working very hard like
asses and have such a hard burden that they cannot bear it because the lusty
desires have created heavy work that puts them always in trouble krishna
comes to introduce the system by which one can get relief from this
continuously troublesome life material life means troublesome heavy work that's
the essence of material line now as regards

religion consists of the laws of God. People who do not know this think that religion means faith, but although you may have faith in something, and I may have faith in something, and although I may believe you, and you may not, may or may not believe me, that is not religion.

There is even a supposedly religious mission that says, you can manufacture your own way, whatever you think is right, that is right. This is their philosophy, wrong philosophy, bogus philosophy, but that is not science.
Supposing I am a madman, is it all right?
Is it all right to think, whatever I think is correct? Is it all right to think like that? How could this be?
2 plus 2 equals 4 is science. If I believe that 2 plus 2 equals 5 or 3, does it become true?
So, there are laws of God, and when there is dharma,
asya glani, deviation from these laws, we suffer.
So, Krishna comes to correct these mistakes, and he shows us the way of devotional service.
And if we follow that, very easily, we can cross over this most difficult material existence.
I will stop here. Thank you.
Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
